title: Princess Diana's iconic wedding snap almost didn't happen due to 'stand-offish' Charles

It was the love story that had captured hearts around the world and an estimated 750million people watched their lavish wedding on TV.

Tens of thousands royal fans lined the streets of London to catch a glimpse of a fairytale princess marry her dashing prince.

Inside St Paul's Cathedral, the ceremony was watched by 3,500 guests, specially selected by Charles and Diana because it could fit more people in.

Diana's stunning ivory silk taffeta gown was embroidered with more than 10,000 pearls.

It had the longest train in royal wedding history at 25-feet and the hundreds of millions of fans watching the pinacle of this love story were in awe of the couple.

(Image: Getty Images)

But there was one image that captured the royal wedding more than any other - Charles and Diana's kiss on Buckingham Palace's balcony.

History Channel's Photos That Changed The World takes at look at one of the most iconic royal snaps.

The fevered interested in Lady Diana Spencer had started as soon as the rumours started that she was in a relationship with Prince Charles.

Former royal protection officer Ken Wharfe said: "Every day of her life was being played out in the media - that wasn't much fun for her."

And when the couple announced their engagement in February, 1981, excitement for the royal wedding was intense.

(Image: Getty Images)

The day of the royal wedding - July 19, 1981 - was bright and sunny in the capital.

Diana's route to St Paul's, which she would make in a royal carriage, had been meticulously planned.

Special stages were erected for press photographers and TV cameras so they could have the best possible views.

Then, the service was over and the newlyweds emerged to greet the tens of thousands of fans waiting for a glimpse of the new bride.

And when the Prince Charles and Princess Diana emerged onto the balcony at Buckingham Palace, the joy of the crowd reached fever pitch.

(Image: Tim Graham/Getty Images)

(Image: Mirrorpix)

As they waved to the sea of people, a chant of 'kiss her' started to spread.

A clearly delighted Diana, reached across to kiss her new husband - but his reaction was not quite the same.

Ken Wharfe said: "Diana looked like she was genuinely enjoying the moment. She was in love with the Prince of Wales.

"But the Prince of Wales was rather stand-offish. Charles was hesistant, whereas Diana went straight in for the kiss."

Princess Diana and Prince Charles' balcony image was the first time a member of the royal family had kissed in view at the palace.

It is a tradtion both Diana's sons, Prince William and Prince Harry , have followed at their own weddings.

Tragically the fairytale didn't last.

Charles and Diana separated in in 1992 and on August 28, 1996, just over 15 years after their marriage watched by millions, the couple divorced.
description: Hundreds of millions of people watched Lady Diana Spencer marry her Prince Charles - but it was one photo that captured the heart of the world
